fields.description: Bottle, size and type not known
Trace element bottle, 12 L, modified Niskin bottle: silicone O-rings, spring replaced with teflon tubing sheathed shocked cord
Net, type, mesh and size unspecified
Pump profiling system, Biological Oceanography, BIO

Oil tow, 243 um, towed on sea surface for 1 nm, sampled about 740 square meters of sea surface to a depth of 15 - 20 cm, see Levy and Walton, 1971: An evaluation of two neuston samplers.  BIO Rep. 71-9: 10 p.
Sea surface microlayer sampler, Garrett screen, see Garrett. 1965.  Collection of slick-forming materials from the sea surface.  Limnol. Oceanogr.  10: 602-605
Ship's seawater line, fixed depth pump mounted on ship's hull
Vertical plankton tow, round opening, 0.5 m diameter, 75 um mesh
Custom water bottle, designed to be short in vertical dimension.  Sealing of end caps was never completely satisfactory

Custom bottle, similar to niskin, used latex springs and other non-contaminating materials, made by Brooke Ocean Technology (BOT) based on a design by. J.-G. Dessureault.  Some problems experienced with bottles leaking
Custom bottle, designed by Scripps Institution of Oceanography
moving vessel profiler designed by Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) and Brooks Engineering
1/2m ring diameter; cross bow attachment to wire
BIONESS with 0.5m x 0.5m frame (AKA MiniNESS). Original MiniNESS equipped with 243 um (front section) and 202 um (back section) nets.
multiple opening and closing net and environmental sensing system
bongo nets attached to VOPC on crossbow
SN (Scott net);  ring net attached to the bottom of the OPC frame
3/4m ring diameter; opening and closing net
flexible rings for pulling through ice-auger holes
3/4m ring diameter; cross bow attachment to wire
1/2m ring diameter; opening and closing net
net attached directly to the OPC outflow; designed to catch all objects that had passed through the OPC
Optical Plankton Counter mounted on the Batfish
Optical Plankton Counter using laser light source
Optical Plankton Counter mounted on the BIONESS
Ship's clean scientific seawater line, fixed depth pump mounted on ship's hull, plastic piping, used by the BIO Forward Lab System
500 L hopper filled from multiple 100 L bottles
Glass fibre filter, mesh size unspecified
modified version of Hardy Plankton sampler, high speed sampler
Stainless steel screen, mesh size unknown
ZOOPLANKTON DATA --special sled designed for thesis
secchi disk with black and white quarters; used to gauge water clarity by measuring the depth at which it is no longer visible from the surface
SBE911+Wetlabs WETStar miniature fluorometer+SBE43 oxygen probe
CTD and rosette bottle sampler: CTD model, sensors & other details to be specified in comment section
Bongo with 65cm frame diameter; (note: it is unclear if this is an inner or outer diameter measurement; the 61cm bongos used during SSIP have an outer diameter of 65cm)

mouth of net on surface of water; a net 12 feet in width by 2 feet in depth and 18 feet in length tapered off to 16 inches at the cod end.  Mouth of net attached to a f12 ft by 2ft rame made of 3/4 inch galvanized pipe.

mouth of net partially above surface of water (floats attached to mouth frame); a net 12 feet in width by 3 feet in depth and 25 feet in length tapered off to 10 inches at the cod end. Mouth of net attached to a f12 ft by 2ft rame made of 3/4 inch galvanized pipe with floats made of 5gal steel oil drums attached to framework
standard sized Clarke-Bumpus sampler; opening/closing net
1m ring diameter, opening and closing net
water samples taken through sampling valve inside the submersible
MAsterflex pump using bevline tubing, drawn from depth

9.1m long integrating sampling tygon tube (3cm inner diameter). End of tube kept above bottom by sounding weight hung 0.5m from tube. Integrating tube system lowered to bottom and water in tube trapped by closing a valve at top of tube. Multiple casts mixed in a carboy to minimize patchiness.

very similar to the design of Mercier (Mercier, F. 1983. Feeding ecology and lipid deposition in migrating Northern Phalaropes in the Quoddy Region, N.B. Unpubl. M.Sc. thesis, Department of Zoology, University of Guelph: 85 pp.)
Opening/Closing ring net used by Dalhousie University during Globec
a modified Benthos Multiple Plankton Sampler
Bothner, M.H., M. Buchholtz ten Brink and F.T. Manheim. 1998. Environmental Research 45(2):127-155 http://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/aquaculture/rd2009/rdmisc-divers_04-eng.htm
ROPOS ROV suction gear; similar to a vacuum cleaner; often used to collect surface sediment
CTD + Niskin bottles on a wire, not rosette

multinet gear, 5 pcs, length: 160cm, net opening: 0.35cmx0.35cm=0.125m2
(Product ID:438 120)
